snippet: Mitt Romney's campaign worked aggressively behind the scenes to make a strong showing.
abstract: Mitt Romney's campaign worked aggressively behind the scenes to make a strong showing.
lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney won the annual straw poll of conservative activists at the Conservative Political Action Conference, or CPAC, conference officials announced on Saturday in Washington. Mr. Romney received 38 percent of the 3,408 votes cast, compared to 31 percent for Rick Santorum, 15 percent for Newt Gingrich and 12 percent for Representative Ron Paul of Texas, who did not attend the meeting this year.

headline.main: At Conservative Conference, Romney Wins the Straw Poll
